I have found that sharing my creativity in teaching art to children has been a most pleasurable experience and have been since 1986, starting with art enrichment programs and continuing with volunteering in my son’s classes since he was in pre-school through elementary school. I have taught in the public and private sector, and for the last 16 years, have staged an art camp at my home every summer with the primary focus in hand building in clay. It gives me much pleasure to share my creative knowledge with students as they delight in their own process of  self expression and experiencing and mastering the art materials.

Activities such as drawing, painting, cutting, and rearranging, fuel imagination and creativity. We have to start the process of creation from simple things, and then go on to create more intricate and challenging crafts. Some art and crafts may look simple but they are not; they involve techniques that need to be learnt. If we know how to make snowflakes we can make paper-sculptures; if we know how to shape clay we can go on to sculpt breathtaking statues and monuments; if we can paint a line we can become a Picasso; the possibilities are endless. The foundation for drawing, painting, and crafting starts at  Kids Be Inspired. Kids Be Inspired classes concentrate on teaching children how to use their imagination most effectively. 

Art classes are intended to be purely creative, yet structured so that a child learns and moves to the next level with confidence. We encourage our students to indulge in undiluted fun, and boundless expression. We teach our students to think out-of-the-box, and to accept challenges in order to create works of art, above and beyond. These classes are designed to be expressions of your child at play; imagining while playing, creating while imagining, playing while creating.

We provide fine art instruction that allows each student to explore their creativity with a variety of mediums and subject matters. With a small student/teacher ratio, each student is able to work on individual projects, pursuing their own artistic goals through assorted media such as oils, pastels, watercolor and much more. Belle Arti focuses on the creative process while stressing classical techniques in a fun and innovative way. We believe that everyone is an artist, regardless of age or past experience, and it is our mission to aid each individual in their artistic journey. Here at Belle Arti, we are able to offer private instruction in an intimate environment that is unmatched anywhere else.

When we encourage our kids to craft, we are helping to develop their fine motor skills, strengthen the connection between their hands and their brain, and oh… yes… they are also having a great time doing it!

Crafting is a way to introduce the concept of becoming a “Maker” and not just a user or a consumer in our world. It is a way to show your child the beauty of making something and selling it at a lemonade stand. The time is now to teach the importance of learning how to make old things in a new way…and to create new ideas for old ways.

Art Trek, Inc. is an independent, hands-on, not-for-profit arts program bringing quality visual, literary and performing arts into the community. It has been active since 1992 and was established as a not-for-profit in 2006.  Our mission is to create a positive and confidence-building experience for individuals of all ages and socio-economic backgrounds: in classrooms, in public facilities, in our studio and wherever we can meet a need. We commit to extending ourselves into high-risk programs, underserved and needy populations, senior programs, social service programs and to educators in professional training workshops. Through our staff and team of 400 volunteers, we currently reach over 20,000 students every year.   Art Trek invites your child (age 8+) to join us from 3:00–5:30pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays beginning Tuesday January 7th through Thursday March 27th, 2014 for its After School Art program at its Newbury Park studio! Students will complete a new project every day!

Umaña Academy was founded on the principle that in order to achieve a perfectly rounded education each child must be nurtured in the arts. Every child possesses an innate longing to express themselves artistically and to develop their natural, God-given abilities. In addition, studies have proven that children who are exposed to the arts at an early age generally achieve a higher level of academic excellence than their peers.
 
Founded in 2005 as a Fine Art after-school program, Umaña Academy featured classes in Music, Art, Foreign Language and Social Skills. Later, Umaña Academy expanded to include a Tiny Tots, Kindergarten and Elementary Homeschool Program with Christian Fine Art Education at its core.
 
Our desire is for your child to enjoy developing in the Fine Arts, to feel confident in their achievements, and to enrich their community because of it. Your child will receive the finest education and will be a part of a larger network of children enriched through the study of the Arts!

column8:
Expressions Dance & Arts is Pleasanton's newest performing arts studio. We opened in September 2012 and expanded to a second studio space in July 2014. We provide dance instruction for all ages in a welcoming, supportive and professional atmosphere. Expressions focuses on the love and enjoyment of dance, and we recognize that students benefit from a balance of family, school, community and the arts.

At Expressions, all students receive high-quality dance instruction from experienced staff. We offer classes in jazz, ballet, tap, hip hop, musical theater, lyrical, contemporary and fusions of these styles. We feature Recreational Dance Classes with in-studio seasonal performances, Recital Dance Classes with seasonal in-studio performances and a performance at our formal recital in June, and a Competition Dance Team that performs at Bay Area dance competitions and talent contests as well as local Pleasanton events and at our annual June recital. 
 
Expressions promotes an appreciation of dance and the arts in an encouraging environment. Our goal is to help all students reach their maximum dance potential and for parents to enjoy their child's dance journey. Expressions Dance & Arts looks forward to being part of that journey.

column8: We are creating excellence in art & Education in Los Angeles, California. We’ve won a ton of awards and have placed students in top colleges throughout USA. Offer Childrens Art Class, Art High School, AP Studio Art/AP Art History, Student Projects, Private Art Lessons, Art Theraphy.

After-School Enrichment Programs (ASEP) was established over 15 years ago and began with a simple premise to create a fun and safe environment for kids to build self-confidence, critical thinking skills and sportsmanship under the supervision of trained professionals.  

The  growth and success of Chess Masters (the first of 9 programs) in over 200 schools and 35 southern California districts was the foundation for the 8 after-school programs that would follow. 

Today, ASEP proudly consists of 9 key programs:

• Cartooning
• Chess Masters
• Comic Creators  
• Creative Kids Studio
• Kids@Play
• Newton's Lab Kids 
• Spanish Explorers
• Spotlight Kids Theater  
• Team Builders

column8:
Our themed summer camps are exploratory in nature, including open-ended invitations to explore different ideas pertaining to the week’s theme.
All camps are four hours in length, from 9-1pm, and are open to children 2.5 -5.5 years of age. Campers can come three days a week (MTW) or five days (M-F) and bring a snack and a lunch.

2014 Summer camps run weekly from June 9 through August 22.

Themes include:
Exploring Art and Nature
Create, Build & Explore the World of 3D Art
Making a Band: Exploring Sound and Music
Mixing, Movement & Master Painters
Inventions, Contraptions, and Ramps
Cooking and Art: Exploring Taste and Texture
Fun, Fantasy, and Fairytales
Paint your own ceramics in our studio, or purchase your supplies to take home!

Art & Creativity for Healing provides support, acknowledgement and personal acceptance to members of our community who are experiencing illness, abuse, homelessness, or painful challenges in life.
Art & Creativity for Healing Inc. shares art as a tool for self-expression and self-exploration, using a self-reflective, guided and structured processes.
Art & Creativity for Healing fine art classes and workshops address the emotional and social aspects of abuse, illness, war, grief or stress via the language of color and painting in order to provide encouragement and motivation for individuals living with in these circumstances.

Studio 3 piano began in Heidi’s home in 1999 while she was still in highschool. She started teaching a friend’s child and ended up with two other students. As word spread she began teaching more students which led to her teaching career. She has studied music in college and taught at Barker’s Music as well as Stockton School of music. At one point in her career she was teaching 62 students per week (which was too much!). Her favorite thing to teach is music theory and preschool music.

What we offer:

-Private Piano Lessons4444

-Group Pre-K music

-Private Pre-K Music

-Advanced Music Theory Tutoring

-Performance training

Open Studio:

Available for the experienced. Spend two hours (minimum) experiencing all the studio has to offer.  $25 first hour; $15 each hour after, plus materials.
To provide a cheerful environment in which inspirational teachers excel at teaching, encouraging, and challenging each student to reach his or her artistic potential.

Red Bluff Performing Arts Centre (PAC) is a place where dreams are created and achieved, by valuing hard work, dedication, community, and creativity. We seek to foster strong values in our students that will stay with them for a lifetime. Red Bluff PAC is a friendly and welcoming place where students of all levels are encouraged to create and accomplish their own individual goals. Whether you are looking to be the next star or just looking to have fun and perform because it’s what you love to do! Every member of our community deserves to have an outlet that makes them feel good about who they are, which is why we offer services for Deaf, Hard of Hearing, and other special needs communities.
We offer a wide variety of classes throughout the year, along with some seasonal options. Our selection currently includes: Jazz, Hip-Hop, Tap, Ballet, Pointe, Modern, Musical Theatre, Improvisation, Choreography, Health and Body Maintenance. We are currently offering classes for ages 3 and up.
column23: Jazz, Hip-Hop, Tap, Ballet, Pointe, Modern, Musical Theatre, Improvisation, Choreography, Health and Body Maintenance

column8:
Discover Painting: Children Classes

Within our "discover painting" classes for children we focus on the fun aspect of painting that occurs when children feel a sense of accomplishment. We pick themes for paintings that make children between the ages of 6 - 13 engaged and interested. These classes last for 90 minutes and run for six (6) weeks. They allow for children to examine different styles and techniques of painting. Each class session allows for your child to come away with a personally successful work of art.

McGroarty Arts Center provides access to the arts through in-depth arts instruction and experiences.  Affordable or free multidisciplinary arts instruction is offered to at-risk youth, children, and families, as are performances, exhibitions, and events that engage the greater public. The Center is a venue for artists to present their work, while preserving the legacy of John Steven McGroarty and his historic home.
